entry.title: #335 The Odd-sum Epic
entry.summary: Cassidy Williams recently featured a ruby coding challenge that spurred a lively discussion of algorithms, and a general marvelling at the loveliness of ruby's Enumerable class. There was however a bit of a requirements trap in the question, not uncommon IRL, but it had me wondering how well generative AI would cope. I put ChatGPT and Deepseek to the test, and the results are in!
entry.content: Cassidy Williams recently featured a ruby coding challenge that spurred a lively discussion of algorithms, and a general marvelling at the loveliness of ruby's Enumerable class. There was however a bit of a requirements trap in the question, not uncommon IRL, but it had me wondering how well generative AI would cope. I put ChatGPT and Deepseek to the test, and the results are in!

entry.title: #330 Shuffle Wallpaper
entry.summary: I thought triggering the immediate shuffle of the wallpaper on a macOS would be a quick scripting task. After wasting too much tim on this, I discovered that it used to be possible, but since at last macOS Sonoma, the System Events API has not kept up with the OS implementation, and now it is totally broken, with no fix in sight.
entry.content: I thought triggering the immediate shuffle of the wallpaper on a macOS would be a quick scripting task. After wasting too much tim on this, I discovered that it used to be possible, but since at last macOS Sonoma, the System Events API has not kept up with the OS implementation, and now it is totally broken, with no fix in sight.
